net.jxta.impl.cm
Interface AdvertisementCache

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractAdvertisementCache, DerbyAdvertisementCache, H2AdvertisementCache, JdbcAdvertisementCache, XIndiceAdvertisementCache
public interface AdvertisementCache

The interface that advertisement caches must implement so that they can be plugged into the CacheManager cache wrapper.

All AdvertisementCache implementations must also provide two constructors, with the same signatures as CacheManager.CacheManager(java.net.URI, String) and CacheManager.CacheManager(java.net.URI, String, long, boolean). This allows them to be used by specifying their full class name in the system property defined in CacheManager.

getExpirationtime

long getExpirationtime(String dn,
                       String fn)
                       throws IOException
Returns the maximum duration in milliseconds for which this document should cached by those other than the publisher. This value is either the cache lifetime or the remaining lifetime of the document, whichever is less.

Parameters:
dn - contains the name of the folder
fn - contains the name of the file
Returns:
number of milliseconds until the file expires or -1 if the file is not recognized or already expired.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

getLifetime

long getLifetime(String dn,
                 String fn)
                 throws IOException
Returns the relative time in milliseconds at which the file will expire. Implementations should remove an expired record if appropriate.

Parameters:
dn - contains the name of the folder
fn - contains the name of the file
Returns:
the absolute time in milliseconds at which this document will expire. -1 is returned if the file is not recognized or already expired.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

                         String attribute,

                         int threshold,

Parameters:

value - contains the value to search on.

threshold - threshold
expirations - List to contain expirations

trackDeltas - when true, changes will be tracked.
